A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Don't believe the FAKE reviews on here! They're clearly paid. Any REAL OG Star Wars fan will walk away from this feeling defeated. 

Let me start off by saying I grew up with Star Wars and all the mythos surrounding the characters. So I'm literally a lifelong fan. 

This movie missed the mark on so many levels I honestly feel cheated. Who as a kid didn't fantasize about the power of Luke Skywalker? Who didn't try to pick up a toy while hanging upside down using the force? 

Issue 1. I'm all for taking female characters to the center stage but they did it at the expense of the male characters. The men were weak\, cowardly and impulsive. The women were strong independent leaders.. Again\, I'm all for having strong female leads but not like this...

Issue 2. The vacuum of space doesn't exist! And where/when did she learn to use the force??? LITERALLY MADE ME SAY WTF!

Issue 3. Campy comedy only applicable in 20'teens earth. Communication connection jokes in a starfighter capable of light speed and Luke Skywalker dusting off his shoulders. REALLY! Also a JEDI would never refer to a lightsaber as a LASER SWORD. 

Issue 4. 17 hours of training and now you're a JEDI. I'm sorry but that doesn't add up. 

Issue 4. The shoehorned relationship between Fin and the female mechanic. Was that even necessary?

I could go on but Disney has sufficiently killed any hope I had for Star Wars. 

Worst Star Wars movie EVER MADE.
